The Center performs the following forms of community outreach.


Soup Kitchen


Volunteer members from the Center serve at Elijahâ€™s Promise Soup Kitchen in New Brunswick every 3rd Saturday of the month.


Brunch Bites


Every Saturday, volutneers prepare lunch bags for distribution to the needy in nearby communities.


Fill the Food Pantries

Canned food drives are conducted to collect non-perishable food to contribute to local food pantries.


Environmental Cleanup


Once a quarter, volunteers clean up the local roads by picking up trash and recyclable items.


Clothing Drive

In the winter, warm clothing is collected and distributed to the homeless.


Personal Items Drive

Volunteers assemble and distribute hygiene kits to local shelters.


Disaster Relief

Volunteers provide help in various ways such as conducting special drives and sponsoring reconstruction whenever natural disasters occur anywhere in the world.


Children's Beanies, Blankets, and Sweaters


Volunteers assemble every second Saturday of the month to knit colorful beanies, blankets, and sweaters for infant.


Children's Service Day


Once a year, children from various nearby districts assemble to offer a day of service through projects ranging from making encouraging cards for the sick to knitting blankets etc.
